clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the SCALED (SCaling AcceptabLE cDs)
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the SCALED (SCaling AcceptabLE cDs) Approach for the Implementation of Interoperable CDS for Venous Thromboembolism Prevention - CDS Data

collaborator.agency: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ)

brief_summary.textblock: This project will adapt a currently deployed Clinical Decision Support (CDS) system to deliver a VTE prevention guideline for adult patients with traumatic brain injury (TBI). We believe this is an ideal PCOR use case given PCORI's continued effort to combat VTE in trauma and our experience previously implementing this guideline. The Our overall goal is to successfully scale, evaluate, and maintain an interoperable TBI CDS across 7 total institutions.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate implementation strategy guided by the EPIS Implementation
primary_outcome.description: the number of patients that received treatment according to the best practice guideline and the % adherence to the guideline per site

arm_group.description: healthcare system leveraging the rigorous approach, SCALED (SCaling AcceptabLE cDs), to guide CDS scaling across the system in VTE prevention.
healthcare system not leveraging the rigorous approach, SCALED (SCaling AcceptabLE cDs), to guide CDS scaling across the system in VTE prevention.

intervention.description: There is no intervention, the hospitals will adopt a CDS system which prompts users to follow best practice guidelines.
There is no intervention, the hospitals will not use the CDS system.

study_pop.textblock: All patients age 18 and older admitted with a TBI will be eligible for inclusion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age 18 and older
- admitted with a TBI
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who die within 24 hours of hospital admission and patients documented as "comfort cares" during the first 72 hours of hospitalization or with mild TBI will be excluded from final analysis.
